cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the southwest Atlantic toward the North Carolina/South Carolina coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southeastern North Carolina coast (around Cape Fear – Surf City area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A at this advisory – no watches yet issued
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A at this advisory – no warnings yet issued
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coastline from South Carolina through North Carolina and into the Mid-Atlantic states
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (≈70%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds and nearly 50% chance of sustained hurricane-force winds at the port beginning late Thursday into Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential life-threatening storm surge of 3–6+ ft possible along the Cape Fear River and adjacent beaches, including the Port of Wilmington waterfront.
weather_observation.rainfall: Very heavy rainfall likely; totals could exceed 10 inches leading to freshwater flooding in and around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large breaking waves, dangerous rip currents, and possible coastal erosion that may disrupt channel/navigation aids and port infrastructure.
